channel.title: My Staging Box
channel.description: Muscle Cars, Classic Rock, Recipes, and Other Stuff

wp:category.wp:category_description: This is the "catch-all" category, for posts that don't fit any of the other categories.
I have a few household tips that might, or might not, be of interest. Feel free to post your own tips.
I'm not a professional cook but I've come up with a few pretty yummy recipes that I'll be posting over time.
Here's some pretty neat stuff for sale.
Here you'll find witty ditties I've picked up over the years. It should be entertaining, if nothing else.
This category is for comments that aren't aassigned to any of the other categories.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: JT
item.content:encoded: I'm trying to get this all set up and working like I want it. That might take a while, but not to worry. I'll get it done. Your thoughts?

item.title: About Me
item.dc:creator: JT
item.content:encoded:
Here, you will find a bunch of fun stuff, like information and opinions about Classic Rock, Detroit Muscle from the 60's and 70's, cooking, and whatever else might come up over time. I hope you find something here that provokes a comment.
I grew up in the 60's and am basically just an old "hippie". AM radio was my main source of musical entertainment, so Led Zeppelin, Jimi Hendrix, Cream, Rare Earth, Three Dog Night, and other groups from that era were very influential in shaping my musical tastes. Likewise, Detroit Muscle Cars were displayed on showroom floors of car dealerships, which in turn, heavily influenced my taste in cars. Big blocks were THE thing to have. Numbers like 396, 454, 383, 440, 426, 427, 428, 429 were all the rage, at least for teens of the time.
I lived in a small town in West Texas and "dragging main" was the most popular past time around. Today, that same town almost appears to be a ghost town because the teens of today apparently had rather spend their time on Facebook or My Space or Twitter and not honking as they passed each other on Main Street. Those were much slower, simpler times than today. And it's sad that the kids of today don't really have a chance to just be kids. With the availability of "too much information" via the Web, kids are exposed to WAY too many things with which they really shouldn't have to learn or know about until AFTER their "childhood" is behind them. But it is what it is. No more walking up and down the streets dressed in their Halloween costumes, no more riding bicycles just for fun, no building rock forts with plastic soldiers in the alley, no more just being a kid for the sake of being a kid.
I'm doing this site for a couple of reasons. 1) I like building web sites and 2) this is a way to pay homage to the great times and wonderful memories that I have of my childhood. I hope you find the site enjoyable, informative, fun, funny, and worth visiting often.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: muscle car, music, classic rock. hot, spicy, cooking, recipes

item.title: Muscle Cars
item.dc:creator: JT
item.content:encoded: I've loved Muscle Cars since I first saw them showing up in dealership showrooms in the 60's. To this day, I can't get enough of them. The body lines and the sounds coming out from under the hoods just make me smile. I've owned a number of them but got into a financial bind in the mid-90's and had to sell them all. I've been working on a way to restock my collection ever since.

item.title: A little more about Me
item.dc:creator: JT
item.content:encoded: I grew up in the Muscle Car era and have had a fascination for those monsters of the street ever since. I'm looking for a way to acquire my own Muscle Car collection. Oh well, maybe one of these days it will happen.

item.title: Classic Rock
item.dc:creator: JT
item.content:encoded:
Rock 'n Roll started coming to life with Elvis, Bo Diddly, Chubby Checker, and others. However, it wasn't until the "hippie" generation started coming of age that ushered in the music of the Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, Rare Earth, Jimi Hendrix, The Guess Who, Three Dog Night, Cream, The Who, Badfinger, and others.

This is the music that caught my attention and to which I still listen to this day. I'm just another "baby boomer" that carries the likes, and some of the dislikes, I formed during the tumultuous 60's and 70's.

I'll be developing this section of the site with what are the "Best of....", in my humble opinion, a number things from that time in terms of music and the people who created the musical genre now known as "Classic Rock".

item.title: Car Stuff
item.dc:creator: JT
item.content:encoded: I'll be asking trivia questions in this thread related to Muscle Cars in general or about a specific car. For example, what is the year, make, and model of ""Eleanor" from "Gone in 60 Seconds"? The first correct answer will receive a $1.000.000 prepaid ATM card funded by my Mafia Wars cash account. Course, I haven't found a place yet who will provide ATM access to those funds, sitting at around $200 billion. So, for now, this thread will be just for fun. :)

item.title: Recipes
item.dc:creator: JT
item.content:encoded: I enjoy cooking and will use this section to list recipes I have come up with and encourage you to add your own recipes. I like hot 'n spicy foods, so most of my recipes include MexItalianSpiceRack.com spices as well as fresh jalapenos most of the time. My cooking methodology is "cooking by the seat of my pants" since I normally have something in particular that my taste buds are screaming for. As such, I go to the kitchen and just start pulling stuff out of the freezer, pantry, and/or refrigerator that will satisfy that craving at that partilar moment.

item.title: I'm so broke...
item.dc:creator: JT
item.content:encoded:
I'm so broke I'd have to get a cosigner on a loan to pay attention.
He's/She's got more dollars than he/she has sense.
I'm known for being cheap entertainment from time to time.
I've had my moments but I don't remember them.
I DO have a reputation to live down to.
My worst sex I ever had was good.
